entities.description: "MT systems are the machine translation systems being tested for gender bias in their translations."
"Hawkins is referenced as the source of the claim that German's similarity to English may explain the better performance of translation systems in German."
"Microsoft Translator is a machine translation system that performs significantly better on male roles in translation tasks."
"Zhao et al. are referenced for defining stereotypical and non-stereotypical gender role assignments and their impact on translation system performance."
"Google Translate is a machine translation system that shows better performance on pro-stereotypical assignments and deteriorates with antistereotypical roles."
"WinoMT is the corpus used to test the performance of machine translation systems, especially in the context of gender bias."
"The US Department of Labor provides statistics used by Zhao et al. to define stereotypical gender roles, which are used to measure the performance of translation systems."
"Spanish is one of the languages tested in the study of machine translation systems' performance on gender bias."
"Russian is one of the languages tested in the study of machine translation systems' performance on gender bias."
"Ukrainian is one of the languages tested in the study of machine translation systems' performance on gender bias."
"Hebrew is a language where gender for certain words cannot be distinguished without diacritics, leading to ambiguity in morphological analysis."
"French is a language with a contracted determiner used for both masculine and feminine nouns, contributing to ambiguity in gender identification."
"Italian is a language with a contracted determiner used for both masculine and feminine nouns, contributing to ambiguity in gender identification."
"German is one of the eight tested languages where translation systems often achieve their best performance, possibly due to its similarity to English."
"Table 2 denotes the difference in performance between male and female translations, indicating a significant bias towards male roles."
"Table 4 shows the performance of Google Translate on Spanish, Russian, and Ukrainian gender prediction accuracy on the original and modified WinoMT corpus."
"Figure 2 depicts Google Translate's performance on gender translation across tested languages, showing better performance on stereotypical assignments."
"Section 3.3 describes the modification of the WinoMT corpus with stereotypical gender adjectives to test the impact on translation bias."
"Figure 1 is referenced as an example of how the addition of gender-specific adjectives can alter the translation of a sentence."
"3.3 Fighting Bias with Bias is the section where the authors discuss their experiment to reduce profession bias by modifying the WinoMT corpus."
"3.4 Human Validation is the section detailing the process of estimating the accuracy of gender bias evaluation by comparing human annotations to automatic methods."
"Papineni et al. are referenced for their work on the BLEU metric, which is traditionally used to evaluate MT systems."
"Isabelle et al. are mentioned for their work on challenge sets for language-specific idiosyncrasies in machine translation systems."

relationships.description: "Hawkins provides an explanation for the performance of MT systems in German, attributing it to the language's similarity to English."
"Microsoft Translator performs significantly better on male roles in German translation tasks."
"Google Translate's performance on gender prediction accuracy is tested using the WinoMT corpus."
"WinoMT uses statistics from the US Department of Labor to define stereotypical gender roles for testing translation systems."
"MT systems are tested for gender bias in Spanish, showing improved performance with stereotypical assignments."
"MT systems are tested for gender bias in Russian, showing improved performance with stereotypical assignments."
"MT systems are tested for gender bias in Ukrainian, showing improved performance with stereotypical assignments."
"MT systems face ambiguity in morphological analysis due to the lack of diacritics in Hebrew, affecting gender identification."
"MT systems' performance is measured by the difference in performance between male and female translations as indicated in Table 2."
"Google Translate's performance on gender prediction accuracy is detailed in Table 4 for various languages."
"Google Translate's performance on gender translation is depicted in Figure 2, showing better performance on stereotypical assignments."
"MT systems are tested for bias by modifying the WinoMT corpus as described in Section 3.3."
"MT systems' translation of a sentence is exemplified in Figure 1, showing the impact of adding gender-specific adjectives."
"MT systems' bias is the subject of the experiment described in 3.3 Fighting Bias with Bias, where the WinoMT corpus is modified."
"The accuracy of gender bias evaluation for MT systems is estimated in 3.4 Human Validation through human annotations."

"MT refers to machine translation systems, which are the focus of the study evaluating gender bias."
"GitHub is the platform where the data and code for the study on gender bias in machine translation are publicly available."
"The BLEU metric is a traditional method for evaluating the quality of machine translation systems."
"Gender bias refers to the tendency of machine translation systems to translate based on gender stereotypes rather than meaningful context."
"Challenge sets are specially created test sets used to evaluate machine translation systems on specific linguistic phenomena."
"Synthetic English sourceside examples are人造的英语样本，用于构成WinoMT测试集，可能引入数据和评估中的人工偏见。"
"Natural 'in the wild' instances refer to real-world examples that could be used to augment the WinoMT test set."
"Ground truth entity gender refers to the correct gender annotations for entities in the data used for training and evaluation."
"Gender-balanced MT models are machine translation models that aim to reduce or eliminate gender bias in translations."
"A debiasing scheme is a method proposed in the study to reduce gender bias, relying on an oracle coreference system."
"An oracle coreference system is a hypothetical, perfect system used in the debiasing scheme to identify and handle gender bias."
"Section 3.3 is the part of the study where a rudimentary debiasing scheme is presented."
"Eight diverse target languages refers to the languages into which machine translation systems were evaluated for gender bias."

relationships.description: "WinoMT goes beyond the traditional BLEU metric introduced in Papineni et al., 2002 for evaluating machine translation systems."
"WinoMT is composed of synthetic English sourceside examples, which may introduce artificial biases."
"WinoMT could be improved by augmenting it with natural 'in the wild' instances."
"The study evaluates gender bias in MT systems across eight diverse target languages."
"MT systems are traditionally evaluated using the BLEU metric, which the study argues is insufficient for capturing gender bias."
"Challenge sets are used to evaluate MT systems for gender bias, going beyond the BLEU metric."
"The debiasing scheme presented in the study relies on an oracle coreference system, which is not applicable in real-world scenarios."

entities.description: "WinoMT is a challenge set for gender bias in machine translation, created by combining the Winogender and WinoBias coreference test sets."
"Google Translate is a widely used machine translation model, representing the state of the art in commercial research."
"Microsoft Translator is a widely used machine translation model, representing the state of the art in commercial research."
"Amazon Translate is a widely used machine translation model, representing the state of the art in commercial research."
"SYSTRAN is a widely used machine translation model, representing the state of the art in commercial research."

"Edunov et al. (2018) refers to the creators of a machine translation model that won the WMT’18 on English-to-German translation."
"The Fairseq toolkit is a resource used for the pretrained models provided by the academic models of Ott et al. (2018) and Edunov et al. (2018)."
